display_asset.caption: Demeza Delhomme is the mayor of Spring Valley, N.Y.
display_asset.credit: Bryan Anselm for The New York Times

summaries.body: If you think the presidential campaign is uncivil, try politics in Spring Valley, N.Y. Infighting has become the norm on the village board, frustrating residents.

display_asset.caption: Backstage at the Gucci fall 2016 women’s show during Milan Fashion Week.
display_asset.credit: Valerio Mezzanotti for The New York Times

summaries.body: Beginning next year, Gucci will no longer hold different shows for men’s and women’s wear, but will rather combine the two into a single show each season.

display_asset.caption: From left, Simon Cowell, Paula Abdul and Randy Jackson at the judges’ table on “American Idol” in 2002.

summaries.body: After 15 seasons, "American Idol" will end its run in a three-part series beginning Tuesday night. Here are some of its most memorable moments.

display_asset.caption: From left, Jeffrey Fina, Steven Fina, Ashley Fina and Michael A. Fina at the Michael C. Fina store on Park Avenue.
display_asset.credit: Sasha Maslov for The New York Times

summaries.body: Michael C. Fina, the Park Avenue retailer known for wedding registry finery, plans to close its sole brick-and-mortar store in Manhattan and team up with Amazon.
Global warming could lead to an increase in public health risks, including the proliferation of insect-borne diseases, according to a report released by the White House.
"It's a trap!" The warning by Admiral Ackbar became one of the most beloved lines in the "Star Wars" series. The actor who voiced the role, Erik Bauersfeld, has died at 93.

posts.footer: Beverly Cleary, the children's book author best known for her character Ramona Quimby, is sanguine about turning 100 this month. The Washington Post

display_asset.credit: Christina Koci Hernandez/San Francisco Chronicle, via Corbis

summaries.body: Go ahead and fuss. Everyone else is.

Students at Columbia are protesting the university's plans to place a Henry Moore sculpture in front of Butler Library, saying it looks like "a poorly formed pterodactyl” that doesn’t fit in with the campus.
The Taliban released an app in the Google Play Store last week that gave users access to their Pashto-language website. Two days after going live, the app was removed.

display_asset.caption: Wheaties boxes featuring, from left, Edwin Moses, Janet Evans and Greg Louganis will appear in stores by May. A petition to put Louganis on the box drew more than 40,000 signatures.

summaries.body: Eight months after a documentary about the Olympic diver Greg Louganis inspired a petition for him to be featured on a Wheaties box, the cereal's maker will do just that.

display_asset.caption: Michael D. Stevens, the master chief petty officer of the Navy, the service’s top enlisted sailor, is in charge of coming up with new titles for his service.

summaries.body: In moving to eliminate job titles with a gender bias, the Navy is considering changing dozens ending in "man." But one title has continued to vex officials: yeoman.

display_asset.caption: Cloud cover seen from an airplane window somewhere over Europe in July 2009. New data obtained from 15 years of satellite images reveals how cloud cover can vary from one kilometer to the next.

summaries.body: By mapping the locations of clouds, researchers were better able to predict the location of plants and animals on land, including those in remote places.

display_asset.caption: Gov. Jerry Brown of California signed a bill into law on Monday, enacting the nation’s highest statewide minimum wage of $15 an hour. The law will take effect by 2022.
display_asset.title: California’s $15 Minimum Wage Is Closer

summaries.body: California's governor, Jerry Brown, signed a bill that would raise the minimum wage statewide to $15 an hour by 2022.

display_asset.caption: Joseph Medicine Crow spoke in 2001 at a dedication for a Peace Memorial near the site of the Battle of the Little Bighorn in Montana.

summaries.body: Joseph Medicine Crow, the last living war chief of the Crow Tribe of Montana, died at 102. He was old enough to have known George Armstrong Custer's Crow scouts.

display_asset.caption: Hide your flowers: Snow surrounded daffodils in Williamstown, Mass., on Sunday.
display_asset.credit: Gillian Jones/The Berkshire Eagle, via Associated Press

summaries.body: Your whiny wintry weather questions are answered. Spring forecasts call for snow, wind and wildfires. And El Niño didn’t help the California drought. Here’s a rundown.

display_asset.caption: A mural of Woodrow Wilson in the Wilson College dining hall at Princeton University.
display_asset.credit: Mark Makela for The New York Times

summaries.body: The board of trustees at Princeton University has voted to keep Woodrow Wilson’s name on campus buildings, despite student protests over his views on race.
Because of weather conditions, the Yankees have postponed their home opener, which was scheduled for 1:05 p.m. on Monday. The game will be made up at the same time on Tuesday.

display_asset.caption: Andrew Choi, center, the executive producer of “Ten Years,” with directors and cast members, after accepting the statuette for best film at the Hong Kong Film Awards on Sunday.

summaries.body: Chinese state media is suppressing news that "Ten Years," about a dystopian future for Hong Kong under Chinese rule, took the top honor at the Hong Kong Film Awards.

display_asset.caption: Palestinian fishermen in Gaza on Sunday. Israel changed the Palestinian fishing zone off Gaza to nine nautical miles from six.

summaries.body: Israel has expanded Gaza's fishing zone, allowing Palestinians access to areas that had been off limits for a decade.

display_asset.caption: The gates of a cemetery, typically closed to the public, in the Shapingba district of Chongqing, China. During the Cultural Revolution, the city was the site of bloody battles between rival Red Guards, and many of the dead are buried here.
display_asset.credit: Gilles Sabrie for The New York Times

summaries.body: A cemetery in Chongqing for those killed during the Cultural Revolution briefly opened its doors on Monday for Qingming, China's festival for honoring the dead.
A start-up is trying to bring on-demand service to an unlikely industry: blood donation.

display_asset.caption: The Powerpuff Girls will return to Cartoon Network on April 4 in a new series.

summaries.body: Eleven years after their television series ended, the Powerpuff Girls are returning to Cartoon Network in a new series that debuts Monday night.

display_asset.caption: Caitlyn Jenner at the Vanity Fair Oscar Party in Los Angeles, Calif. in February.
display_asset.credit: Emily Berl for The New York Times

summaries.body: Caitlyn Jenner will appear on the next season of "Transparent," the Amazon series that follows a 70-year-old transgender woman and her family in Los Angeles.
A New Orleans man accused of shoplifting $31 worth of candy could face 20 years to life in prison as he is being charged under a Louisiana habitual-offender law.

display_asset.caption: Inclement weather could again postpone opening day at Yankee Stadium, as it did in 2003. The Yankees will open the season against the Houston Astros.

summaries.body: Don't give in to Cracker Jack cravings just yet. The rainy, chilly weather predicted for Monday may force the Yankees to postpone their home opener for the first time since 2003.

display_asset.caption: A runaway bull was taken to the Animal Care Centers of NYC in Brooklyn after it was captured in Jamaica, Queens.

summaries.body: A bull escaped a holding area in Queens and went for a leisurely stroll before it was corralled at York College. Oh, and Jon Stewart gave it a lift to its new home.

display_asset.caption: Andrew Sullivan in 2007.

summaries.body: Andrew Sullivan, a pioneer in political commentary during the early days of blogging, will join New York Magazine as a contributing editor.

display_asset.credit: Dmitry Kostyukov for The New York Times

summaries.body: A renegade group called We Are the Oracle has been holding semi-secret parties in the catacombs and abandoned chateaus of Paris.
The dropping of criminal charges could affect a civil suit against a man who is accused of posting "revenge porn" of a former girlfriend online.

display_asset.caption: A message in chalk outside a campaign event for Donald Trump in De Pere, Wis., on Wednesday. Some students at Emory University in Atlanta say that there was an anti-diversity subtext to the so-called chalking written on campus about Mr. Trump.

summaries.body: Students at several colleges are clashing with officials and debating free speech limits after finding chalk messages supporting Donald J. Trump scrawled on campus property.
